derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from dialect groin 'snout', from Old French groign, from late Latin grunium 'pig's snout', from Latin grunnire 'to grunt'

means.word_mean: 1. a protective structure of stone or concrete; extends from shore into the water to prevent a beach from washing away
